episodeTitle: I'm Not Gonna Hand Over the Blueprints! Franky's Decision!
description: Franky reveals he possesses the Pluton blueprints and makes a critical decision to burn them in front of Spandam, betting everything on the Straw Hat Pirates' ability to rescue Robin. The crew uses the Rocketman train to crash into the Tower of Justice at Enies Lobby.

events.title: First Episode with Crazy Rainbow Opening
events.description: Episode 284 marks the debut of the eighth opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow' performed by Tackey & Tsubasa. This opening would continue for episodes 284-325, spanning the Enies Lobby arc.
events.significance: Introduces a new opening theme that becomes iconic for the Enies Lobby arc, one of the most beloved arcs in One Piece.

events.title: Franky Reveals He Has the Pluton Blueprints
events.description: Franky shocks everyone by revealing that he has been carrying the blueprints to the ancient weapon Pluton inside his body the entire time. The blueprints were passed down from Tom to Iceburg and then to Franky.
events.significance: This revelation explains why Franky has been targeted by the World Government and CP9. The Pluton blueprints represent one of the most dangerous pieces of knowledge in the world, capable of creating a weapon that could destroy the world.

quotes.text: The blueprints you've been searching for all this time... they're right here!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky reveals to Spandam that he has the Pluton blueprints

events.title: Franky Acknowledges Robin's True Character
events.description: Franky tells Robin that he misjudged her based on rumors about her past. He now understands that she never intended to abuse the power of the ancient weapons, contrary to what the World Government claimed.
events.significance: This moment shows Franky's growth in understanding and marks a turning point in his relationship with the Straw Hats, particularly Robin. It demonstrates his ability to see past propaganda and judge people for who they truly are.

quotes.text: I know now... you're not the kind of person who would abuse the Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky apologizes to Robin for misjudging her

events.title: Franky Burns the Pluton Blueprints
events.description: In one of the most pivotal moments of the arc, Franky uses his Fresh Fire ability to burn the Pluton blueprints to ashes right in front of Spandam. He declares that he's betting everything on the Straw Hat Pirates' ability to rescue Robin and defeat CP9.
events.significance: This irreversible decision destroys the only known blueprints to one of the three ancient weapons, fundamentally altering the power balance in the One Piece world. Franky places complete faith in the Straw Hats, marking his spiritual joining of the crew even before the official invitation. It also ends CP9's five-year mission in failure.

quotes.text: If Nico Robin is to be taken by you now, the world will end. But if the Straw Hats win, what you'll have left is absolutely nothing at all. Personally, I'm betting on their victory!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's declaration as he burns the blueprints

events.title: Franky's Bet on the Straw Hats
events.description: After burning the blueprints, Franky explicitly states that with the blueprints gone, there is now no power to resist the ancient weapon if Robin falls into the World Government's hands. He's betting entirely on the Straw Hats' victory.
events.significance: This moment establishes the high stakes of the battle ahead. If the Straw Hats fail, there will be no backup plan. It also shows Franky's complete faith in Luffy and his crew, foreshadowing his eventual joining of the crew.

events.title: Spandam's Fury at Mission Failure
events.description: Spandam loses his composure completely after witnessing Franky burn the blueprints. He realizes that CP9's five-year infiltration mission to obtain the Pluton blueprints has ended in complete failure.
events.significance: This moment demonstrates the enormous resources and time the World Government invested in acquiring the Pluton blueprints, all undone by Franky's single act of defiance. It establishes Spandam as increasingly desperate and dangerous.

quotes.text: It's burnt to a crisp! Damn it! I'm gonna kill you!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam's reaction to the blueprints being destroyed

events.title: The Straw Hats Await at the Drawbridge
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates await the lowering of the drawbridge that will allow them to reach the Tower of Justice where Robin is being held. The crew is determined to rescue their friend.
events.significance: This moment builds tension as the crew prepares for their final assault on Enies Lobby. It demonstrates their unwavering commitment to saving Robin despite the overwhelming odds against them.

events.title: Zambai's Kaitai Buttagiri Technique
events.description: Zambai, one of the Franky Family members, uses his technique called 'Kaitai Buttagiri' during the battle at Enies Lobby.
events.significance: This introduces a new technique from the Franky Family, showing their contribution to the rescue mission and their fighting capabilities.

events.title: Kokoro Brings the Rocketman
events.description: Kokoro arrives with the Rocketman sea train at a critical moment. The train that was built by Tom, Franky's mentor who also worked on Gold D. Roger's ship, becomes instrumental in the rescue mission.
events.significance: The Rocketman represents the legacy of Tom and his connection to the Pirate King's era. Its use in rescuing Robin symbolically connects the current generation of pirates to the previous one.

events.title: Rocketman Crashes into Tower of Justice
events.description: Using Kokoro's assistance, the Straw Hat Pirates and their allies execute a dramatic assault by using the Rocketman train to crash directly into the Tower of Justice, catching Franky as he falls.
events.significance: This spectacular entrance marks the beginning of the final phase of the Enies Lobby battle. It demonstrates the crew's determination and creative problem-solving, using the sea train as a battering ram to reach Robin.

quotes.text: The blueprints you've been searching for all this time... they're right here!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky reveals he has the Pluton blueprints

quotes.text: I know now... you're not the kind of person who would abuse the Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky apologizes to Robin for misjudging her

quotes.text: If Nico Robin is to be taken by you now, the world will end. But if the Straw Hats win, what you'll have left is absolutely nothing at all. Personally, I'm betting on their victory!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's declaration as he burns the Pluton blueprints

quotes.text: It's burnt to a crisp! Damn it! I'm gonna kill you!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam's reaction to the destruction of the blueprints

themes.description: Franky's decision to burn the Pluton blueprints represents his complete faith in the Straw Hat Pirates, trusting them to save Robin and prevent the World Government from obtaining the ancient weapon.
themes.symbolism: The burning of the blueprints symbolizes the destruction of the past and placing hope in the future generation. It represents choosing trust over security.

themes.description: The episode explores the weight of legacy through the Pluton blueprints, which were passed down through generations. Franky must decide whether to preserve this knowledge or destroy it.
themes.symbolism: The blueprints represent dangerous knowledge that can be used for good or evil. Tom's legacy is honored not by preserving the blueprints, but by having faith in the right people.

themes.description: Franky's burning of the blueprints is an irreversible action that changes everything. Once destroyed, there is no going back, raising the stakes for the Straw Hats' rescue mission.
themes.symbolism: The fire that destroys the blueprints represents Franky's commitment and the finality of his decision. It's a leap of faith with no safety net.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates tremendous growth and courage by destroying the Pluton blueprints and placing his faith in the Straw Hats. This moment represents his spiritual joining of the crew and his rejection of the World Government's pursuit of dangerous weapons.
keyActions: Reveals he has the Pluton blueprints inside his body
Apologizes to Robin for misjudging her
Burns the Pluton blueprints with Fresh Fire
Declares his bet on the Straw Hats' victory
Gets rescued by the Rocketman train
quotes: If Nico Robin is to be taken by you now, the world will end. But if the Straw Hats win, what you'll have left is absolutely nothing at all. Personally, I'm betting on their victory!

characterSpotlights.role: Antagonist witnessing the failure of his mission
characterSpotlights.development: Spandam's desperation and cruelty are on full display as he witnesses the destruction of the Pluton blueprints, realizing that his five-year mission has ended in complete failure.
keyActions: Demands Franky hand over the blueprints
Loses his composure and threatens to kill Franky
quotes: It's burnt to a crisp! Damn it! I'm gonna kill you!

characterSpotlights.role: The person being rescued and reason for Franky's faith
characterSpotlights.development: Robin's earlier declaration to live (in episode 278) has inspired Franky to trust in her character and the Straw Hats' ability to save her.
keyActions: Receives Franky's acknowledgment of her true character

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes for pacing, including the moments leading up to Franky burning the blueprints and the Rocketman's dramatic entrance.
Additional reaction shots of CP9 members were added in the anime to emphasize the significance of the blueprints being destroyed.

trivia.fact: Episode 284 is the first episode to use 'Crazy Rainbow' by Tackey & Tsubasa as the opening theme. This opening would continue for 42 episodes through episode 325.
This episode adapts parts of chapters 399 and 400 of the manga. Chapter 399 is titled 'Jump Toward the Waterfall!!'
Toei Animation stopped airing ending themes starting from episode 279, so episode 284 did not have an ending song. This practice continued until episode 1070.
The scene where Franky burns the Pluton blueprints is considered one of the most pivotal moments in the Water 7 Saga, as it represents Franky's complete trust in the Straw Hat Pirates.
The English dub of this episode was released on DVD on September 3, 2013, simulcast on September 7, 2013, and later aired on Toonami on January 17, 2015.
